BfbWK-EZiFvcmVttrQiYsw.text: I had candy and water in my hand with 4 other customers before midnight and we were told we had to put our items back to leave.   This place looked cool but it turned out to be a bunch of hipster angst.  Cool story hipsters.   Staff here were big POS's especially the cat with the horrible leather jacket.  Unless you want to be a victim of high school revenge then don't go to this wack establishment.

ve2RopVuuu2FIifLJyd7fw.text: If you are a vegan or vegetarian staying in the area, here's your spot! The market has a great selection of prepackaged foods, fresh out of the kitchen options and coffee. We ordered two vegan breakfast bagels packed with soy sausage, avocado, spinach, tomato and tofutti cream cheese. It's so refreshing to find a breakfast option that doesn't involve hummus . The coffee is also tasty, and don't forget to pick up a package of the No Evil Foods meat-alternative sausages (The Stallion) - so delicious!

kNP-uoEcpuzcP73EuzQrfA.text: LOVED the Californian sandwich on multigrain bread. With a bottle of sauvignon blanc at a picnic table in the sunshine on the patio, my friends and I really really enjoyed our time here.

hrx6RC2JHSHPgtH7OHqQAw.text: M wife, my daughter and I went here a couple of weeks ago after reading about it online in "the Charlotte agenda". What a surpise....haven't been in the central area in a while...so it felt like a hidden gem..I ordered a tuna sandwich and had a beer while we waited. The beer & wine selection is wonderful...it ties in very well with the bar...Most places put mayo in their tuna...this place did not, and it was the best tuna sandwich I have ever had. Keep up the good work guys! I'm going back when the first opportunity presents itself! 5 stars!

bETwJncJ9iLJ23DsD4L1vg.text: Great beer selection and a lot good food in the cafe, with vegan options. Everything is very reasonably priced. I wouldn't recommend going later at night unless you love crowds and tight spaces. Sometimes it can be obnoxious.

RePw-dcrE0coxE0WhxMLpw.text: This place is super hipster. Think of it as a NY bodega filled with vegan/hipster conscious wording to attract a certain group of people.   The market area I skimmed through because the craft beer and random stuff won't concern me during my trip.  I did however go to the deli side to order the Reuben sandwich. Which I thought was pretty good.

dJZVZnLZHolyuCHJ7rNdlw.text: Got breakfast at another place in NoDa and was so disappointed that we left and went straight to Common Market for a second breakfast lol... The breakfast sandwiches and pimento grits were awesome. We also had a green juice from the juice bar that was solid. Thank you CM for saving our Charlotte breakfast. You're the real heroes.

84pSPTh-v1FDUTGmgSyosg.text: This place is a gem. EXCELLENT selection of craft beer, wine and interesting international food/candy.   They also have a small deli where they make simple, delicious sandwiches for a very reasonable price.   I would highly recommend this place if you're looking for a cool, eclectic place to grab a drink or sand which.

UojJwrsv3tt_DqX-z7bkaA.text: Been a long time fan - dropping by to grab a sandwich after yoga class at Arrichion (the CM by Southend is better, I think) -- the grilled tofu with cheese is an amazing sandwich. Always friendly service, both at the cafe and behind the counter.   I love you can buy alcoholic beverages in the fridge and consume them on the premises. A concept Europeans haven t got yet:) The selection is as good as it gets. Something for everything. When I asked about ciders, then swung me around a corner. Also a wine lovers haven -- asked specifically to recommend wines from Napa/Sonoma region before heading out there, and the lady gave me tons of great recommendation (where I actually visited the wineries of!)  Can t say how much I love this place!

m-SQydh7HPgDpkT4sXAJgQ.text: A non-corporate meca for those who don't want to give their money to The Man. Buying products here is supporting small business and conscious entrepreneurship. Without places like the Common Market our world would be full of cookie cutter corporate franchises. The common market is the cornerstone for Plaza Midwood culture. This is where you'll find some of the most prominent characters that support the Charlotte subculture. These are the people that give Charlotte a soul. If you don't like this place you may want to go hang in Ballantyne  with all the other consumer puppets.

UXDHoyvmuro9XdIQBBZzUg.text: Awesome place.  Just go there and hangout, meet wonderful and diverse people, have a good time.  Wonderful selection of craft beer and wine.

4iEM56fgCG5JqSkIajBCzA.text: One of the best vegan sandwiches I've had.  The vegan dawn comes with soy sausage, but I'm allergic to soy.  The guy offered to substitute the sausage for an extra hash brown, no up-charge.  Also VERY reasonable prices!!

waAZW6YkYSHIymVapvxEVw.text: A total hipster joint. That isn't a bad thing, I like the place but the kind of people that hang out there aren't my kind of people. I will continue to hit it up when I am looking to chill though!

gq87eycsRCs-RGwS1MTZjg.text: Great atmosphere where everyone is welcome. Trinkets are a plus too. Always a fun time

KW3EG4v65QeNqXh4O6tUAg.text: Thomas and his gang over here ooze with everything that I love about Charlotte - friendly, down to earth, come as you area attitudes that make you feel good about whatever you are (crust punk? banker? dog lover? bible thumper?).  A great selection of cold beer, they've got 4 taps here and a great deli serving up some vegan/veggie/carnivore treats throughout the day and early evening. Everything's fresh which is nice compared to the other quick places in the area that seem to deep fry their best stuff (hushhhhpupppppieeeeesssss). Along with some novelty items, you can also pick up some standards incase HT across the street is closed. Be sure to check out their outdoor patio area, too! It gets crowded quick but on a nice evening it's the place to be, often times with live music!

n8vayCv30vD9NTkbH8LGNA.text: I visited CM for lunch this weekend.  I have only been to the one in Southend, so I was excited to try this one out.  Walking up, the crowd of people outside were definitely a little...different.  But, I got past that and went in to order a sandwich.  The spicy turkey sandwich, which was delicious.  It was also reasonably priced, which is always a added bonus.  I definitely recommend CM if you are looking for a tasty sandwich...and some good people watching.

UMLIH8sa_QDYpqRyD5gC7w.text: Visited this local deli recently while on a business trip.  Went in and ordered the Evil Homer, their most popular cold sandwhich.  The sandwhich was made from quality ingredients and while it wasn't bad it also wasn't anything special.  It was a basic turkey sandwhich with bacon lettuce, onions, pickles and cheese.  The price was good around 7.50 for the sandwhich if I remember correctly and their selection of beers and ales were superb.  Definitely a good place to stop by for a quick lunch, but wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.

p2fhpWcCxr1HkEvVNDyAdA.text: A definite five-star experience.  You can get a unique, and ever changing list of, draft beer from the bar, or just pick one from their extensive selection in their cooler and have the cashier crack it for you.    Lots of cool options, and a deli where I first came to like spicy mustard (after 28yrs) because they have the fantastic Boars Head w/ White Wine product in packets.  It can't really get much better for a place that is technically a convenience store (on steroids)  The workers have been much friendlier in recent visits since the time that I originally reviewed the CM.

Gb_dCUZZk03vRQz-uF7naA.text: They don't carry any of my favorite beers and I still want to make this a regular stop on my weekends. I've only been once, but I hear tales of live music and delicious food.... I love the crowd, all hipster ish and semi conscious and somehow still cool about it. It's a great space even though there's a complete disregard for one's desire to sit down. You can still make it work if you try, though. My friend and I found some space on the patio bench and pretty much camped out with our purchases. It was good.

1qBhF_62pKjRSUbDhH1cIQ.text: Okay, so I go here for beer and socializing. For that this place gets four stars. It is unique, the clientele is .... Interesting, and the beer and wine selection is the best possible within four miles of my house. When I come in here to buy beer(let me know if your experience is similar), I tend to spend 15-20 minutes in the beer aisle, eyes 10 inches from the glass. The salivation and incredible indecision have to make my alcoholism and beer snobbery apparent.  If you like beer and wine and live near this place it should be your go-to "support a local business" place to stock up for your grill out, fancy dinner party, or lonely binge.   On to the food, though. I don't like it. Maybe it's just not my style but ive eaten here three times and never enjoyed it. Take that with a grain of salt, my friends sing their praises to the high heavens of the deli.   In summation: buy beer here. Buy wine here. Imbibe in the unique atmosphere, with some unique music, then stroll over to snug harbor for a crowd so unique you won't even think you're still in Charlotte. Try the food, if you like it let me know, I want to find something I like to eat here!

WJ0MExbC5BebWftpPeNUcA.text: Common Market is a great place! It has one of the best beer selections in Charlotte. (They also have a lot of wine) You can get good microbrews for a decent price and enjoy them there or take them home. There is occasionally live music and other events on the patio and behind the store. But even when there's not the patio is still a great place to sit and socialize. The only downside to the patio is that it isn't that big and can get crowded and smokey. Inside there is a great atmosphere with an eclectic music selection and usually interesting people with whom you can talk. Inside there is also a deli area with sandwiches, soups and salads. The menu includes vegan options if that's your thing. There are also a lot of interesting trinkets you can buy.  The Common Market is a great place to sit with a group of friends, a special friend, or by yourself. There are areas that get very loud but there are a couple corners you can find that are quiet enough to read by yourself all the while enjoying tasty beverages and food. It's also in a great neighborhood where you can walk to a number of other fun places.

T8bobJXLCSKHZOiPBN4rkQ.text: They have a really good beer selection that's unique and diverse. The coffee is quite good here too! The only downfall is this place is it can get a little crowded but I guess that just speaks to how cool it is.  I love little places like this.

XqFvW0V3ugepCyc6uiu8Nw.text: Dog friendly, great sandwiches, lots of gluten free options, super fun!  They randomly have live music during the week and it's a fun, casual place to meet for a drink or food.  Plus their brunch is delicious- the fresh squeezed juices are a must.

lm0xgqWOuVu3sa03G2-bGA.text: I'm a touch partial to the CM in South End, even though I know this is the original mamma jamma!   Really, what's not to adore? A myriad of interesting bottled beer and wine, fresh pints off the tap, a great crowd and excellent live music. Plus, if you're feeling snacky, there's a plethora of choices - tasty sandwiches, chips, cupcakes, salads, soups, etc. There's a bite for everyone, regardless of your culinary curiosity.   And yes, Common Market offers some of the best people watching around. It's a very delicious utopia, right in the heart of Plaza Midwood.

RinazghiLtwlTqqALUwH3A.text: The Common Market is cool without being pretentious about it. It's like that guy in high school who says, "yes, I can pull off pink, and I dare anyone to say something about it". The infusion of  listening to Frank Sinatra sing New York New York while gazing at an angry pumpkin next to a zombie donkey mask (I know I didn't think that sort of thing existed either) gave it that hip punk feel. Good local taps, and bottle selection. Sandwich was also tasty.

9brlSuhSHakYgwQoSLDVGg.text: It was an odd place to say the least as it pertains to dining out and drinking.  But, I really did enjoy it.  The beer was cold and cheap.  A dog friendly place too.  The patrones appeared to be the unemployed Starbucks types, sorry to Stereotype.  But, a descent place and great company.

imrBpCNHbMrFI0GAo12idg.text: Lurves me some Common Market (4.5 stars!) The main thing to recommend this place is their extensive and impressive beer selection. They literally have something for every season/taste In winter I was warming up with some stouts and now that summer has rolled around I'm kicking back and enjoying a nice hefeweizen.   After you've picked up your food/beer you have the option of leaving or enjoying it on their tiny tiny back patio. I always choose the latter as I enjoy socializing with my buddies and watching the super diverse crowd that is rolling through. (They're also watching us. An older lady told my friend and I that we were "very pretty boys"..thanks?)  Often they have live music that is also a treat.  The price is right. Service is meh but it's a gas stations (basically) so whatever and the overall vibe is pretty cool. Definitely a spot I recommend.

OFd7MTPQhyK4JMfBUSMOmQ.text: This is one of those Queen City institutions that I show off to any friends and family from out of town. CM may only be just ten years old, but it has countless lives' worth of personality and flavor. Each time I visit, I still find something I've never seen before among the decor which is full of character. Their excellent beer selection is always changing, and don't miss out on the deli. They make great sandwiches to order. My favorite brunch item is the huevos rancheros in a spinach wrap. The patio is also great for people watching; everyone is welcome at the Common Market.

4AJXsTB3rlhhdTK2Agvf7A.text: Great beer/wine selection, good sandwhiches and a really cool atmosphere.

aDEq4wTmjLRnPxkDfalb9Q.text: An incredible selection of beer! Why spend $3-4 for a shitty Miller Light draft at the bars next door when there are plenty of great microbrews here for half the cost? And best of all, you can drink them in-store! Well, after paying, of course.  That said, despite this Mecca of delicious and unique beer at your disposal, your crowd will be mixed with hipsters drinking cheap PBR, because thats what hipsters do. ::shakes fist:: HIPSTERS!!!  But I digress.  There is also a really good Boars Head deli on the premises. May I recommend the spicy turkey with pepperjack cheese on sourdough bread? Yum.  Simply put, I love this place.   And don't worry, I love you too, hipsters.

Peze3qIILpvGSALBtPSPjw.text: Common Market gets 5 stars from me.  I've never really been to a place that is so diverse from the people to the establishment itself!  It's a great deli and they always have something for the vegans.  My favorite part of CM is the alcohol selection, especially since you can drink on site.  They have a small bar area where you can get draft beer and the taps are always rotating.  There is also a large cooler filled with beers from all over the world.  It's wonderful to find a great beer without any prior knowledge of it's existence.  The wine selection is also good.  I'm not a wine connoisseur, but I've been given great recommendations any time I've asked the staff.  The best part of all of this is you can pay retail prices for your booze and drink it there.  It's nice they're usually bumping some good tunes too (at least for my taste in music).  Where else can you chill out at a place with a bottle of great wine for 10 bucks?  The people watching is just fabulous at this place too...hipsters, hippies, 9-5'ers, bums, babies, you name it.  Cheap drinking and great people watching.  Love it.  Oh forgot to mention they have free wine and beer tastings, live music on the patio, and it's also a convenience store......Remember, I said it was diverse!

how8BByqdlV7ZiOumABkXA.text: Everything about this place is funky and eclectic from the appearance to the patrons and the music and the store/bar/coffee house.  It is a great place to hang out with friends, just people watch, meet new people, have a beer or get coffee, grab a deli sandwich.  The have a wide selection of craft beers and some seasonal beers on tap.  The Midwood area is awesome and this place is one of the reasons.

AWkKkjVqeL_92nw0HX60rQ.text: I'm going to start by saying I LOVE the Common Market store and ESPECIALLY the one in Oakwold. This location has the biggest jerks working there. We tried to order at the deli and had a couple of questions regarding offerings and were rudely spoken to and made to feel like A-holes for opening our mouths. Then the girl behind the counter was COMPLETELY rude to me when I was buying two bottles of wine. The ONLY saving grace was the nice older gentleman who helped me pick out my wine. This occurred on Tuesday, November 20th around 2:00PM in case management isn't in the same customer service practices as the rest of the staff. SAVE YOURSELF A DAY RUINER by driving a few extra miles to the Oakwold location.

QkUltqyf4LbyEnbqjqCyUQ.text: The soul of plaza mid wood. Snacks, drinks, novelties. Punk rock atmosphere and great for a quick bite. This place is filled with character and history, a must go to if in the area.. Ask for bartender Matt- he'll cater to all your beer needs, accompanied by great conversation. On weekends they have love music.   PS- vegetarian/vegan menu in their deli section!

EP8wqRC8FdFSqm_W1w2OfQ.text: Decent food but terrible experience trying to get it. Breakfast sandwiches should not take close to an hour to make. I don't care how crowded you are. And by the time I finally got my food only a couple people were left waiting and I still had to ask a manager. Not sure what's going one with the people in the back. One guy kept reopening sandwiches he had already wrapped. And we weren't the only ones waiting that long. Just awful and unnecessary experience.

GcBquSktMtQfibl-gNWb7g.text: It's hard to find what else to say about this place, since so much has already been said. So, I will be brief.  This is a neighborhood staple. Everyone comes here: young, old, rich, poor, every race, ethnicity, you name it. They make great sandwiches and have classic snacks and a massive beer, wine and cider selection.   They've recently expanded the interior to include a real bar with beers on tap and booths inside, which adds to the two already awesome outdoor areas (one which is like an alleyway and the other which is the front patio). It's a great way to eat lunch and hang out all day, drinking retail price beverages with a casual deli restaurant type atmosphere.   Also, they have the good chips. Like, the really good chips that will make you break any diet plan you're on, especially after a few mimosas (which they sell all the ingredients for) and a really good made-to-order sandwich from their deli.

0UTc9zIrdbGGTrqzAu9b6Q.text: If you are wondering where to go if you are in Plaza Midwood look no further. The Common Market is a staple for the area. They have a little bit of everything in there! The inside has so much going on. There is a place to order food, a huge section of it reminds me of a convince store. There are baked goods, candy bars, chips, gum, etc! Then in the back of the store there is a large selection of craft beers and wine that you can buy to go. They also have a bar area where you can order a beer on draft or have a nice glass of wine!   My boyfriend and I did the wine tasting one evening and it was fun! The man that facilitated our tasting was nice and friendly. He explained each wine in detail and you could tell that he is well versed in the subject of wine! It was refreshing.   One area of improvement would be the bathrooms. It is a hit or a miss if they are clean or not. There are only 2 bathrooms available, so the line can get quite long! The last time I went one bathroom had some gross stuff on the inside back part of the toilet and the other bathroom had such a strong smell of urine that I couldn't even go in there and that's saying a lot for me!! But like I said, you never know what they will be like because one time I went and they were fairly clean! Just prepare yourself!   Overall, if you live in Charlotte (or are visiting) and you are looking for a place to visit that is special in Charlotte you need to stop by!

2Fjip59YOMmvUgYFjNmQFg.text: Wow, I did not know what to think about this place when I walked up to it, but became very impressed once I walked in. We gravitated to the bar and had a glass of their excellent house draft. The coolers are filled with beers and wines that you can purchase and drink out on the patio. What a wonderful idea, mega selection and save some money by buying a six pack and splitting it with your friends. Great coffee and breakfast options are on offer. This makes for a great hub for the neighborhood, I am very all in on this place.

1n0lz88a0QoXpOZw2Ced1A.text: Had the day off so I was biking around Plaza Midwood. Stopped by Book Buyers first (also a 5-star review) so get some great, cheap reading material, then had to figure out a lunch plan.   I did my best Lance Armstrong impression (sans PEDs) over the the Common Market. I've come through here a few times to grab a beverage and once got a sandwich (but that was after a few beverages so I didn't appreciate it) so I decided to hit up the deli counter again. I got the "Just Back From Brazil", which was one of their daily specials. I'm very much a carnivore, but when I chose the Brazil the ingredients looked so good I DIDN'T EVEN NOTICE IT DIDN'T HAVE MEAT! WHAT?!? Avocado, hummus, lettuce, a mango-sriracha sauce, red cabbage, green bell peppers, carrots, cucumbers, and sprouts in a lettuce wrap. **sigh**  Someone once described the Common Market atmosphere to me as "steampunk". Wouldn't fully agree with that, but it definitely has a different vibe. I showed up one afternoon straight from work (for corporate America) and caught more than enough stink-eye to last me for the week while wearing my shirt and tie. Who cares though?! It's an awesome place with all sorts of different people. Can't fault anyone for being themselves! I'd take all the stink-eye you can throw for some of their $3 pints on Thursdays.

jJtCnxIsp-Qo0iniJLozHg.text: I don't even know how to start to describe this place... Everyone I talked to said we had to go and check it out, especially if we liked beer and people watching. This place definitely fit the bill!  To begin, this place is a literal market. More of a bodega really. You walk in to a small snack shop. They have local cheeses and meats and jar items. And chips, and t-shirts, and cigarettes. If you turn right there is a deli in the next room. There's a cooler with premade sandwiches, salads, pastas, cheeses, etc. And they have vegetarian and vegan items aplenty in there. There is also a random vending machine for musicians with drum sticks and stringed instrument strings.   If you continue straight when you walk in past the bathrooms on the left and the register on the right, you'll come to a small 6 stool bar on your left with 15-20 beer taps and a lot of wine options. They also had canned and bottled beer. In fact you can peruse the extensive beer section at the back of the store and drink it thee if you'd like! There's also a few tables and chairs to sit at, but not a whole lot. You can also drink out on their front patio, that has heaters when it's cold.   This was just a very interesting place to spend an hour at on a Saturday night. But it was fun and the beer was delicious and the company friendly. I'd stop back in Everytime I'm in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of The Common Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

XgK5hndo-JKeyGjP20BJsQ.text: The Common Market has two locations: This one in Plaza Midwood and one in Dilworth. They both have a very similar vibe and about the same options. The basics: they have a huge craft beer selection, they have beer on tap, you can drink here, they have awesome deli style sandwiches, the atmosphere is uber hipster.   I came into this location on a rainy day and parked over by Whiskey Warehouse. I came up through the back patio area and tried to order food at the bar. This is a little confusing, but you have to go around to the front, where the deli is, to order food. I asked for some recommendations and the girl at the deli suggested the "Old Scratch" on sourdough. The food came out fast and was affordable. I then grabbed a drink on tap at the bar and made my way out to the covered patio in the back.   The sandwich was awesome! They use fresh bread daily made by Golden Grains and this shows. The bread is so fresh and delicious. I'm not even a huge carb guy, but I would just eat a loaf of that sour dough. They also use all Boar's Head meats and cheeses. They have a ton of options as far as sandwiches go.   The outdoor patio, where I sat is a nice change of scenery and it is covered, so you can sit out there when it is raining. They also have seating inside and bar seating as well. This place is just the definition of hipster. I'm not saying that as a bad thing, but it's just the truth. It is so eclectic and just kind of off the wall.   The Common Market is a quick place to grab lunch or a drink. You will be in and out in no time, or you could sit and stay awhile. There are plenty of beers to keep you busy. I will definitely go back to try some more of that awesome bread!

photos.caption: Photo of The Common Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Old Scratch&#34; on Sourdough
Photo of The Common Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. IPA on Patio
Photo of The Common Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu Back

GvbaTtPBoj7FrHJp5Z0i6g.text: Ordered the sandwich special. Almost swallowed a metal twist tie. Thank God it wasn't in a child's sandwich.

-wGQXO-x0eA_bxKnGkM2Ew.text: I  came in 15 minutes to close of the boars head sandwich section and because they were already cleaning up They let me know that the Thai food behind them was good within the same establishment. I ordered my food and after eating one bite I realize that either they served pork or the food was old. When I took it back to the point to sell the gentleman there let me know that it wasn't pork and was not helpful at all. I went and sat back down and thought about it And brought the plate back about 10 minutes later at that point the chef came out of the back  and proceeded to let me know that everyone loves his food and he'll paid money out of his own pocket to be done with me. He snatch the plate out of my hand walked to the back where I could see him and started to bang the plate as hard as he could against the trash.  As a food business owner and a person I would never treat any of my customers like this . I called the chef back over to the point of sale to let him know that I didn't appreciate my treatment and his reaction was uncalled for. The people that were at the common market were very nice and I love the idea of sitting outside however I would never go back there again

BTzeZOBngi6Gd2yrL8MnYw.text: Got a to go order here for the first time the other day. We were pleasantly surprised. The chicken salad deluxe sandwich was delicious and the portion was equally as great. My friend got a Rueben and was very pleased with the taste. We wish they would make the other location come here for training!!!

haavdekLKUy-htt1qyga7Q.text: I've heard a lot about this place and decided to go one night with a friend. It's literally a market where you get what alcohol you want as well as snacks. There are a lot of options to choose from. Lots of beer choices! The snack choices are great especially if you are hungry. There aren't really a lot of places to sit in side but there is seating outside. I would definitely go back.

ItWwvz6-V4BR_k1bW8ZYnw.text: Meh.   I come here every once in a while because of the convenience factor, but I have yet to have a really great sandwich.    People seem to love this place, would even consider it a staple of Charlotte.  Which is probobly why they get away with selling over priced bottles of wine.

UVQVx3yo9PUOB1sowxBtEQ.text: Don't get all freaked out like a whiny, petulant child if you see a Anti-Pat McCrory Deli Special. The owner of the Common Market has a heart as big as the beer selection. Many consider Him a local hero. Besides, is there anyone that actually takes Pat McCrory serious ? lol  One of my favorite places to visit. The Common Market has a great deli, and sandwiches, cold beer and good conversation. There are always friendly people out on the patio to talk to, and the politics, and conversation generally lean to the left. The Common Market is LBGT, and Liberal Friendly. As most people know, This Entire Area is LBGT , and Liberal Friendly. So don't visit and get Butt Hurt. I would highly recommend this place to ALL my friends, a Great place to hang out with a date, or friends, or someone looking for something a little different.

42qfdPfDcLg26jTMQhcu4w.text: This place is unlike anywhere I've been before. A local grocery/market-type store with a bar and indoor/outdoor seating. Very chill atmosphere albeit a bit hipster.   However, it rubbed me the wrong way when a cashier loudly and publicly scolded a woman in a wheelchair for going into the bathroom with a caretaker. I understand that this place has a policy that only allows one person in the bathroom at a time, but yelling "she can use the bathroom by herself, that's why it's called handicap accessible" was rude, ignorant, and off-putting.  3 stars because of the uniqueness and atmosphere, but I was not impressed with the staff.

apZvPJG0vZacg-qmlXPJxg.text: I always get anxiety when I first visit somewhere like Common Market.  Like everyone knows the system of where to order and where to pay and what to get and it's just very overwhelming. Needed some nourishment after a hot yoga class, so headed over to Common Market. I went with the Darby, which is roast beef with horseradish cream cheese, cucumbers, lettuce, tomato and onion. The horseradish cream cheese really made it. Would be great on a bagel. Other than that it was just a pretty typical roast beef sandwich. Took home a firehouse for my boyfriend. Was also just a pretty typical sandwich. They have beer on tap as well as a huge bottle selection and lots of other snack stuff and a deli case with salads and sides. I think its a great place to grab something quick if you are in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Common Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Darby

E3Hq02NigBAScsHokvLQfg.text: The best place to stop after a night out in Charlotte. Great food selection and a comfortable atmosphere.

NOuSDv3DETJ_pRm2S9IW2w.text: Probably the most overrated "Deli" In town. First, when you walk in it instantly smells like unemployment. That could be due to the odd group of both hipsters and homeless people who hang out and smoke hand rolled cigs in the parking lot, but that kinda gives the place a little character. Then, you walk into a seedy corner store setup that you feel like you may get a bag herion with your food if you order the wrong thing off the menu. That aside the food is just kinda average but I think they're going for that. Again, probably not the worst out there but really overrated and I prefer to spend my money at places that value customer service. The staff is just kind of rude but I was wearing my CC hat and that may have triggered them.

photos.caption: Photo of The Common Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

f0JzsWNCnexe0iStUtlFhw.text: This is definitely one of my favorite sandwich shops of all time. You can't go wrong with the supreme pimento cheese sandwich. The service is always friendly, and they also have a bunch of really cool daily special sandwiches.

i_uS_OTTMozktz2zVHakUg.text: It's neither common, nor is it really a "market," since you can sip, nosh, and sometimes listen there. I just love this place. It's one of the reasons I chose to locate so close by. From its sandwich delights, to its yummy handmade desserts, to its awesome well-priced selection of beer and wine, this place has got it covered. And where else can you find so many groovy kitschy bumper-stickers, buttons, and toys (a la Archie MePhee)? Years ago, even my eighty-something grandmother accompanied me here, and she loved it, too! The Common Market has captured an uncommon niche. It's a place where even weird folks are just folks.

MskJ2hM05Np1WkDf0noVdg.text: I have just discovered the Common Market and I couldn't be happier that I did.  It reminds me of a funky little deli from back home so it gives me the warm fuzzies while I peruse their killer beer selection.  They have everything a micro brew lover could want, including big bottles and single serve, build your own 6 packs.  They also have a great wine selection and they even carry sake!  There are lots of snacks, breakfast items, and organic choices, as well as off the wall treats and trinkets like "Obama-mints."  I have never actually eaten at the deli, but I'm sure it's great too.  Oh and you can also buy single cigarettes for 33 cents.....so, if you are craving just one, CM is the place to go.

OiY-XM0pCCzr9piQU522-Q.text: I only go about once a year when visiting a friend but if I didn't live 887 miles away I would be there a few times a week. The sandwich selection is great- even for vegetarians! The fact that you can grab a single beer out of the cooler yourself to go with your sandwich amazes me.

maFqrx7mpsE0jyRM71Lyfg.text: I live just down Commonwealth and absolutely going to Common Market to get one of there deli sandwiches!  The Californian is my favorite.  They have a great wine and beer selection as well and have wine tastings and other events throughout the week!  Check 'em out!

22-UIh2wMiHeA5PFm5pRHA.text: What a great place. It's a little overwhelming when you first walk in, trying to figure out what's going on and what you're supposed to be doing...is it a market, a bar, a coffee shop, a deli?  All of the above.  I was greeted at the door and got a quick explanation about how it all worked.  The Spicy Turkey sandwich was delicious and the guys behind the counter were perfect.  I wanted a local beer and they pointed me in the right direction (it was soo good), and broke down a six pack for my single brew.  Just...great.  Wish I had this place down the street from my house.

gXmXZ5zcVXl1Z_1G5enbTA.text: I came here to meet some friends for lunch while in Charlotte recently and was impressed.  They have a great selection of wine and beer (in single bottles as well as six-packs) and a deli with some fun sandwich/wrap combinations.    Also, there's a fun outdoor space in the back that is perfect for a relaxing lunch or, even better, day drinking.

lvfHgrUyadnEn_5Twj-rRQ.text: maybe I'm missing my deli market from back home, or maybe I'm just a snob, but this just doesn't cut it for me.  It's ok, it has a better than decent beer and wine selection but the deli falls flat. Boars head is not deli meat, or at least not deli meat to be proud of. I mean its fine for a grocery store, but it's not  crap your pants good.  I recently ran to over there hoping to get a loaf of bread to bring home for a dip we made and they only had pre sliced bread, it was a let down.     I also find the staff a little snobby for the product that they carry, but what can you do.  It is great as a wine/beer store, crappy as a deli, so thats why it lands at a three.    For what its worth, my wife is obviously a little meaner than me and said she has a hard time giving it anything higher than a two.  She might be right.

zURsnDV4uoOY3JCR8om8zg.text: I have to say I have had MANY good nights here!!! The wine is cheap the crowd is different but fun and if your in the mood for good different beers this is a good spot!! I love sitting outside in the alley on a nice night!! Cant wait for CM to open in Southend April 1st!!!

_Hi4cC41i2Rc5mphf6shyw.text: I love the Common Market. They have a great beer/wine selection and a patio to hang out on and drink. Awesome deli. Cool toys and neat stuff for people who like bacon. It's my go to spot for switchblade combs.

3V65YgwxV2KkxdkuuK7qBg.text: The Common Market is the best place to go for single good beers- they even let you drink them in the store or on their patio.  Besides having a huge selection of beer and wine, they also have a deli during the day-time that makes great sandwiches, etc.  I also love to browse the candy and assorted treats that the Common Market offers.  This place functions as a convenience store and a deli, but at night it also becomes a hang out for hip locals who wants to relax on the patio and drink and smoke cigarettes.  Open until 2 am!!

8qmQUve_FNspbdDZ6TK6vQ.text: Common Market is one of the best hangouts in Charlotte. It has an amazing beer and wine selection and everyone is extremely friendly. Tends to get a little crowded but even with a full house this place is great to hang out in. Bring your dog, grab a beer and join in on a very cool crowd.

MtwJYMAmgvx9YAAJVqtN9w.text: good samiches, good staff, good beer, everything is lovely, but seriously people, must you all hang out at the common market 24/7? get a life! sheeesh. (you know who you are..)

TqexbGIg3TgDC8UlKioLpQ.text: i  love the cm for a quick fix on food and drinks! its also fun to hang out and drink wine too! im a fan!

7-fj8frHi_GhTibN6Gh_sA.text: I eat here every time I visit my sister. Been here less than a week and had their sandwiches twice already. Employees are super friendly, willing to talk to 2 old ladies, and the food is awesome!!! Worth leaving sunny FL for.

hFs4XKYKHJ31qdyv4YVulQ.text: The original--come enjoy a quick sandwich, good beer, or tasty bottle of wine.  No frills, no expectations, come one, come all.  The CM is a landmark.  So happy it's an integral part of the PM!

f4xRw-EFK7XejnufC8Jang.text: I love this place. It's so laid back, GREAT beers, cool crowd. No yuppies (that I could tell). Hard to find in Charlotte.

U-6sorNoNpvlOGgFRA5Leg.text: Common Market is a hip, cool urban market that makes fantastic sandwiches, sells delicious beer wine and other beverages and offers all kinds of snacks and treats and toys. There are great options for vegetarians (but the chicken salad is a standout if that's your thing). It is one of the very few places in Charlotte that has real authentic character. I love the folks that work there and you can tell that they love working there, too. South End location is awesome too.

AM4no3fO2AEukQRfDFJP_A.text: I've been going to CM for years. This place is seriously cool. Now I live in SC and I even see CM stickers on cars down here. That should tell you something.

kZ6ydWWSEDfvVgqLhwK1BQ.text: yes, i do know the owner - that by yelp standards is a conflict of interest.  and they carry wines from the company i work for - a definite conflict of interest.  but take both of those factors out and i would still be four star fan.  wine?  check.  bottles are well selected and there are lots of price performers out there.  sandwiches?  check.  i'm good for about 3 sandwiches a week due to several factors - a) close proximity to the office, b) the fact i usually forget to make/pack my own damn lunch and c) the sammies are pretty good (not the best ever - but pretty good)  though i do not take advantage of the on premise drinking, it sure is nice to know its an option.

ori8c_cOR12slYsjVw3cSg.text: So good. Soups, sandwiches, vegan cupcakes- all yummy.

J-8IU7r_iyJQdquTLIDRXw.text: A few years ago, I wrote an article for the Charlotte Observer about where to take family and friends visiting from out of town and high on my list was the Common Market.    It's a cool little neighborhood place filled to the brim with lovely beers, wines, juices and sodas, as well as sandwiches & food (from their own deli), interesting munchies and a bevy of novelty candies, toys and merch.  I love the patio - it's gone through some major changes since the beginning, some of which has made it more difficult to hang out back there, but I dig it nonetheless.  It can be a little dirty sometimes, but that comes with the territory when you have many people coming and going all day... even though I think the customers should clean up after themselves out of respect for who might be sitting there next....  Keeping me from giving the full five-star treatment is something that is not really the CM's fault.  Sometimes I don't really want to go there because of how crowded and noisy the place can be with people wearing fake glasses and tight jeans.  I never know when the right time to go is.  You might think its safe to go on a Monday night, and you get there and find it's so damn crowded that you can't continue with your mellow hangout plans.  C'est la vie!   But still, I love the Common Market!

lXeP87R_YUnUi9-_DbUhnA.text: It's a little pricey in my opinion, but the Common Market is one of the greatest places to find some interesting vegetarian lunch foods in Charlotte.   I enjoy their barbeque tofu, and they've got some fantastic sandwiches. The whole she-bang will usually run you around $7, which is expensive when you think you could get the same deal from Subway for significantly less...but you feel better in your soul when you eat local!   Common Market is near Yoga One, which is where I get my downward dog on, so I find myself over there a lot. The staff is friendly, the wine and beer selection is top-knotch, and the food is good.  Another of my favorite parts of this shop is their little weird toy section. I have a stretchy, squishy, sticky red pig that I keep in my kitchen window that came from there, and also a set of unicorn action figures emblazoned with the Russian hammer and sickle vs. one with the US flag pattern. Where do they find this stuff?

OBoVVtYjIReaTzHXOTjVpg.text: What can I say that has not already been said. Amazing deli and friendly staff, this market is an example of what we need more of in this town. Fresh food, local music and great crowd!

ftCpbiNys-DFgC7K57IsoQ.text: This place is AWESOME! Great beer and wine selection and the deli has specials.      ( vegetarian and non vegetarian )  to make you drool! YUM! Also with the street under construction, I had my lunch delivered to me by a cute boy on a bike.!! A great  place with an eclectic and friendly staff!

GE1Rl5rYswTgZDsLe0E7OA.text: I have a hard time trying different sandwiches (either breakfast or lunch) because the Capri is so delicious, when I've strayed everything I've tried has been good. This is our favorite neighborhood breakfast spot, and a treat when I can make it over for lunch.  I recommend this place to anyone looking for a good, inexpensive sandwich.

30InxuSoIhB2fF0w165k6A.text: This place is like your favorite baja that you got at your first music festival way back when that seems a bit raggedy to others, but feels good and just makes you happy when you put it on.  Granted as a resident of MorComm I am biased as this place is near and dear to my heart but it is not to be missed if you are in the hood.  Way back in the day when Blake and Cress first realized the dream we jumped on board and have been enjoying the ride and the experience ever since!!!  Whether it's dropping in for morning coffee, breakfast/lunch/brunch from the deli or beers beers beers... this place has become the heart and soul of our neighborhood.  It embodies the best of what MorComm and Midwood have to offer... the crowd is the most eclectic thing you can imagine, from Izods and sperrys to skinny jeans, nose rings, full tattoo sleeves and mohawks you will see it all here.  People arrive by Range Rover, blown out Honda, Fixie bike, skateboard, or just cruise in on foot and fall in together and enjoy the scene.  The food is great... breakfast picks in our house are the "later hater" on everything bagel grill pressed and pimento cheese grits (yes you read that right), and lunch is a "Jack Kennedy" (egg salad and horseradish spread with bacon) on marble rye.  If you are into beer, then just go over and settle in and drink your way through the cooler... you will not be disappointed!

tXzPFEGBjYq4xwBQRKorHg.text: Common Market is the freakin' jam!  If you're in Plaza-Midwood and scoping out a convenience store/coffee house/beer market/bakery, you should visit this place.  It's practically a hipster general store.  They have a lunch counter that is packed at lunchtime.  Your typical lunch counter staples, like reuben on rye, clubs, and paninis, but with fancier breads, meats, and cheeses.   They have a convenience store selection of chips and homemade cookies/brownies to complete your lunch. Did I mention that they are several brews of coffee?  Plus, its only a $1 if you bring your own mug!  The beverage selection is out of this world!  Many foreign brands with many, many syllables.    Common Market is also loaded with hipster trinkets;  like dress-up Jesus magnets, cooler and more socially conscious-than-thou bumper stickers, and "papers"...he he.  So if you want to get your lunch on, caffeine on, or just roll your own...this is your joint.

y7LnL-yJtd7E7EkNH3boVQ.text: This place is just what the doctor ordered if you are seeking a True taste of a very original Charlotte business!  Food is so fresh!!!!   I got my graze on a kicking Ruben, while my wife went nuts over all the vegan choices on the menu.  She got the hot mama!!  We could even feed the kids with the pbj and pb and banana!  I really loved the food, crazy assortment of chips, and had a hard time choosing which beverage  would round out my meal.  Went with the blue sky green tea!     Beer lover that I am fell head over heals with that selection too!  This is now one of my favorite once a week stops!  Prices were really good for the quality of their stuff!!

eQYbQPhVoykHZr2PhyYQ8g.text: Having just moved to Plaza Midwood from Los Angeles, I have to say, I love the unpretentiousness of this place! It's right across the street from my new place, so I'm there almost everyday. I love everything about it. The owner is very cool, and I dig that they play great music. The other day I heard Op Ivy and it made me feel like I was in high school again! I'm a musician, so I'm definitely interested in checking out the bands on weekends. Haven't done the "beer" night either, but sounds totally fun. They have an amazing selection of beer and sake and their deli is always super good for lunch. i recommend the grilled cheese with tomato or the California. So yeah, it's a bunch of hipsters maybe, but I LOVE this place. It's totally original!

KANwrGfsU0Y6EZMTg_Rg2g.text: Excellent beer selection, delicious deli, enjoyable people watching- what more can someone want?

gyjVmt-yzWYySMPgEFSdfQ.text: Killer market, sammys - I can't wait until they open in Dilworth!   Coming soon I hope. . .early 2009

tOI8ffMA1hy5Jl-WWkWE9A.text: Everybody should love The Common Market. Its great. The live music is usually pretty awesome. The drink and food selection is good (and they carry Burt's Bees, another plus!) and the people are fun. There are very few things that can beat cracking open a fresh snapple and sitting down at the common market to people watch on a Friday Night ;)

ngV4pIBdBGTKOUrpQ8jMvw.text: Just went today fir the first time. Great atmosphere, good food (blt) and great drink selection. I'll be back!!

0s6S_sLCnSwvMWSZ6kE--w.text: Gotta love CM. Employees are always chill and awesome, their beer selection is tops (come with some cash to spend, microbrews are not cheap), and the deli kicks booty for both meaters and non-meaters alike. I have to admit a current addiction to the chickpea-batter fried cashews-- its like a cashew falafel, SO good.

V9qnOUr3_Bj15t6naaqu2w.text: Very casual atmosphere.  I love it here.  It's super relaxed and friendly.  Their carrot cake is to die for.  Will definitely visit regularly!

IvG2C6Js3rMoAb3xmvUIlA.text: Where else can you find fridge magnet dress sets for President Obama AND Sarah Palin side by side? Who else offers beer, bitters and "Before, During and After Sex" breath mints. Where else can you order a microbrew under the watchful eye of Lando Calrissian? Need to pick up another pack of tree tea oil toothpicks or Jesus sticky notes. This is your place. It's the only convenience store/deli/wine bar/pub/coffee shop I've ever been in?  There is even an outdoor side area where I suspect smokers can enjoy a cigarette. These guys have raised eclectic funk to an art form. Check it out next time you hit Thomas Street Tavern or The World Famous Penguin and be reminded of how fun life can be.  The clientele is as eclectic as the merchandise with a smattering of housewives, punkers, Goths, gays and 20-somethings. It's so encouraging to see such funk and diversity alive and well in button-up CLT! Bravo!

QX_yhwmlDtKVwVikC9FwEw.text: What I like so much about Common Market is the wine selection.  They have unusual and hard-to-find wines.  I believe I will miss this place when I move.

nGwB7-ntkFekwxrssSjzKQ.text: Here in Chicago we have plenty of BYOB restaurants, but nothing can top the experience of Charlotte's Common Market. I have fond memories of my visits to the Common Market over the years. March of '05 was my first visit. There, I purchased my first bottle of Pom and my first bottle of wine. On that same day, I learned that filling an empty Pom bottle with red wine makes for a perfect disguise. Since then, I always make it a point to rally some friends together and head here to drink in their quaint courtyard. Not only is the beer and wine selection incredible, and not only do they provide glasses for you to immediately begin drinking, they also have an fantastic community board that can help guide an outsider to the best nightlife in the city.

lAh0DgPf9FX7QHiPUvA1Xg.text: I have spent many Wednesday nights at the Common Market for their fantastic beer tastings.  Tommy does an excellent job of bringing in interesting microbrews from around the world for everyone to try.  The Common Market routinely gets beers before anyone else in the Charlotte area.  The selection is hard to beat and is always changing.  The staff are wonderful and attentive and know their beers!  And yes, there are hipsters galore, but when there's good beer, who cares?

RHn_u15SvA9uKln_2_-SMA.text: Can't go wrong with the common market. It's as close to a bodega as one will get in the south. Drinks, snacks, doodads, nicknacks, alcohol, and some great prepared food. My wife and I love their food. They make my favorite pimento cheese sandwiches in the world(as I have said in other reviews, I am a southern boy through and through).  The pimento cheese deluxe is a work of beauty and taste like falling in love. My wife loves the ranchero burrito. If you are a coffee drinker, my wife loves their iced coffee. Whether you are just going for chips and a soda or you want lunch or dinner, this is the place to go. I also like that people from all walks of life, ethnic backgrounds, and interests shop here, which is great. Now due to the variety, some times it may not be the most kid friendly place to eat, but even at those times, you can get your food to go.  Whether you are suit and tie  person or a tattoos and cutoffs type a person this is your market. Oh and P.S. I also love the pimento cheese grits.

8vUwa6bxw55gX7NBY-19VA.text: I went here for lunch and got the spicy turkey sandwich with tofu instead of turkey-- it was way too spicy for me and I could not finish! My friends got the vegetarian wraps and those looked really good! You can ask to have your wrap grilled if you prefer warm food.

7Y9tqg5F0Kv9w3SQh8qy7Q.text: This place is a little hole in the wall. Very eclectic. It's located inside of a store. The menu has great options for everyone. Including vegetarian and vegan options. Pictured I got the chickless salad with sprouts, tomatoes, carrots, balsamic vinaigrette and romaine lettuce. Added my own seasonings. The wrap was great as well. It had sprouts, avocado, tomatoes, vegan cream cheese, bell pepper and I added tofu. I would definitely recommend if you're looking for something to do or don't mind eating outside on the patio.

MgBYzJ-PQscVtxkK-3RceQ.text: The staff is great with outstanding information about the beer.   Loved the music playing outside on the patio.   Beer selection was very good and had local Carolina offerings.   Really cool vibe outside and inside. May not be for everyone but it's a great place to see for yourself.  PMBC Plaza Midwood Bar Crawl  December 29, 2017

yRAUz_gmzRPtuwAsfiMMyg.text: Simply put, I am neither pierced, tattooed, nor hip enough to frequent this Common Market on a regular basis. Sure, I'll run in and out real fast to pick up some beers or lunch to go, with my head hung low so as not to attract attention. But, I never linger because I just can't handle the crowd that does hang out here. #iamold   If you are slightly uncool and don't have a hip bone in your body like yours truly, might I suggest you check out the new Common Market Oakwold. Now, there is a place that I can (and do) hang out at multiple times per week!

photos.caption: Photo of The Common Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Common Market Booze Bag. $5 for the bag and you get 10% off beer and wine purchases for the life of the bag!

etYz1vQpBPm7-ESg62cUSw.text: Common Market is a neighborhood general store and deli. Ive heard it described as the local country store where you can purchase a fried fish sandwich the likes of which you will never find again.   In the case of Common Market, local seafood is repliced with a wide selection of New York Style Deli options. Unlike other local delis, Common infuses vegan, gluten free and organic options to the menu.  It gives you a small town feel in the midst of one of the fastest growing cities in the nation. The old style fish and tackle store without the hooks and cane. The real deal in Charlotte.  People hold on to the establishment as a local icon. The Deli options are inventive and there is a wall of odities that would remind Xenials of Spencers, but kid friendly. The patio is dog friendly and parking continues to be accesable despite the unique location in the heart of Plaza Midwood.   Roco used to be my favorite Columbian styled, purveyors of incredible Carribean sauces. It still is but Common Market has it all. Almond milk to vegan cookies form part of the multilayered inventory of this one of a kind, hybrid market deli.   The staff is brilliant and always attentive. The enviorment is dynamic and diverse. Moreover, the arts and local artist are supported by the neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of The Common Market - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Common Market - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Common Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

5_kvfvL0QBceg3eG1dOkow.text: This place is awesome. The foods is simple and delicious. No fancy sauces, just simple consistently good food.

x19AJdWivuNpZtQPyjcClQ.text: I loved the vibe and the amazing beer selection. But my sandwich was very disappointing, with very little turkey and very thick bread. You order at one place, pay at another place, and go back to the first place to hear when your order is ready. I would definitely go back for the beer and vibe, but probably not for a sandwich.

rCmybTH_A0zuAvLnpJTPhA.text: Came here in search of vegan breakfast but worried it wouldn't deliver since most of the places I've been to lately have no handle on it whatsoever.   Walked in and was greeted by good vibes and hipsters. Always a good sign for vegan!!   Went straight to the ordering counter and ordered the vegan special which was soysage, daiya cheddar, veganaise, spinach, tomato and hashbrowns on a spinach wrap and drumroll.....VEGAN GRITS!  After I placed my order, I began perusing the shop while waiting for my order. I opted to pick up some lunch options from the cold case. I selected the garlic sesame noodles and vegan chicken salad.  Then I took a lap around the store side. Some great options including fresh coffee  and pastries.   While perusing the drink cases I came across my favorite San Pelligrino pomegranate aranciata. SCORE!!!!   Everything I purchased was just over $15!  When I got my order I ran to the car to photograph and partake since the little seating they had was occupied.  OMG it was the most delicious breakfast I've had as a vegan thus far!! The wrap was perfectly crispy from the panini press. The cheese and the veganaise gave a perfect creaminess--a texture I often miss as a vegan. The grits had the most perfect consistency and didn't need anything added. As a former cheese grits addict, it was unbelievable.   And what better than my aranciata to wash it all down!  Breakfast of champions!  The garlic sesame noodles were absolutely amazing and I enjoyed the mock chicken salad as well, though I typically like mine with a little bit firmer of a texture.But the flavor was spot on!  So happy I made it here finally! This will be my go to place for vegan breakfast going forward. Now just to find  sit down vegan breakfast and vegan brunch!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Common Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Perfect vegan grits
Photo of The Common Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1 of 2 places that I know of in Charlotte that sells these treasures
Photo of The Common Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegan breakfast special 3/23/2017

jC2lhY4RAzkWhobqlBXotQ.text: Hipster sanctuary. Epic deli with no frills atmosphere and great sandwiches. Breakfast sandwiches the best, cheesy with generous scramble of eggs. Lots of bread choices and everything is customizable. 'Later Hater' is a no brainer. Picnic tables, dogs, biker feel. Grab coffee from across the street before you order and be prepared to wait a bit for your food, it's worth it though.

q_Lnz8MbMpDrUkARibIKqw.text: Live this place. Have been a customer since they opened. Unique one of a kind establishment. We love to go over and grab a beer or wine from the cooler and hang out and have a brew or I go over and grab a tasty sandwich or wrap for lunch with uses tasty fesh, local ingredients. No other place like it.
